df-map
blocks.content: Define the mapping operation or set exponentiation. The set of all functions that map from ` B ` to ` A ` is written ` ( A ^m B ) ` (see ~ mapval ). Many authors write ` A ` followed by ` B ` as a superscript for this operation and rely on context to avoid confusion other exponentiation operations (e.g., Definition 10.42 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 95). Other authors show ` B ` as a prefixed superscript, which is read " ` A ` pre ` B ` " (e.g., definition of [Enderton] p. 52). Definition 8.21 of [Eisenberg] p. 125 uses the notation Map( ` B ` , ` A ` ) for our ` ( A ^m B ) ` . The up-arrow is used by Donald Knuth for iterated exponentiation (_Science_ 194, 1235-1242, 1976). We adopt the first case of his notation (simple exponentiation) and subscript it with _m_ to distinguish it from other kinds of exponentiation. (Contributed by NM, 8-Dec-2003.)

blocks.name: df-pm
blocks.content: Define the partial mapping operation. A partial function from ` B ` to ` A ` is a function from a subset of ` B ` to ` A ` . The set of all partial functions from ` B ` to ` A ` is written ` ( A ^pm B ) ` (see ~ pmvalg ). A notation for this operation apparently does not appear in the literature. We use ` ^pm ` to distinguish it from the less general set exponentiation operation ` ^m ` ( ~ df-map ). See ~ mapsspm for its relationship to set exponentiation. (Contributed by NM, 15-Nov-2007.)

blocks.name: mapprc
blocks.content: When ` A ` is a proper class, the class of all functions mapping ` A ` to ` B ` is empty. Exercise 4.41 of [Mendelson] p. 255. (Contributed by NM, 8-Dec-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm mapprc(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wceq(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1)), emptycls))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wceq(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1)), emptycls)), diffsc(s0, c1))
  necon1bi(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1)), emptycls, wcel(c0, universe))
  sylbi(wne(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1)), emptycls), wcel(c0, universe), wex(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1)))
  abn0(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  exlimiv(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe))
  syl6eqelr(c0, universe, cdm(cv(s0)), wf(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  fdm(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  dmex(cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: pmex

blocks.name: mapex
blocks.content: The class of all functions mapping one set to another is a set. Remark after Definition 10.24 of [Kunen] p. 31. (Contributed by Raph Levien, 4-Dec-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm mapex(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2)), universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2)), universe), wss(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2)), cpw(cxp(c0, c2))), wcel(cpw(cxp(c0, c2)), universe))
  sseqtr4i(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2)), cpw(cxp(c0, c2)), cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), cxp(c0, c2))))
  ss2abi(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), wss(cv(s0), cxp(c0, c2)))
  fssxp(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  df-pw(s0, cxp(c0, c2))
  pwexd(cxp(c0, c2), universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  xpexg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  ssexg(cab(s0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2)), cpw(cxp(c0, c2)), universe)
  diff.cxp.s(s0, c0, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mapex(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí { s0 |(s0 : c0 ‚Üí c2)} ‚àà ùïå)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylancr((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), { s0 |(s0 : c0 ‚Üí c2)} ‚àà ùïå, { s0 |(s0 : c0 ‚Üí c2)} ‚äÜ P((c0 √ó c2)), P((c0 √ó c2))‚àà ùïå)
  sseqtr4i({ s0 |(s0 : c0 ‚Üí c2)}, P((c0 √ó c2)), { s0 | s0 ‚äÜ(c0 √ó c2)})
  ss2abi(s0, (s0 : c0 ‚Üí c2), s0 ‚äÜ(c0 √ó c2))
  fssxp(s0, c0, c2)
  df-pw(s0, (c0 √ó c2))
  pwexd((c0 √ó c2), universe, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3))
  xpexg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  ssexg({ s0 |(s0 : c0 ‚Üí c2)}, P((c0 √ó c2)), universe)
  diff.cxp.s(s0, c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: map0e
blocks.content: Set exponentiation with an empty exponent (ordinal number 0) is ordinal number 1. Exercise 4.42(a) of [Mendelson] p. 255. (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 14-Jul-2022.)

blocks.name: map0
blocks.content: Set exponentiation is empty iff the base is empty and the exponent is not empty. Theorem 97 of [Suppes] p. 89. (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2003.)

blocks.name: mapsn
blocks.content: The value of set exponentiation with a singleton exponent. Theorem 98 of [Suppes] p. 89. (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2003.) (Proof shortened by AV, 17-Jul-2022.)

thm mapsn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(co(c0, cmap, csn(c1)), cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cop(c1, cv(s1)))))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)

  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  ax-mp(wceq(co(c0, cmap, csn(c1)), cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cop(c1, cv(s1))))))), wcel(c0, universe))
  mapsnd(s0, s1, c0, c1, universe, universe, wcel(c0, universe))

  diff.universe.s(s1)
}

  elmapd(cv(hs0), c0, c3, c1, universe, wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cmap, c3))))
  simpll(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cmap, c3)))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cmap, c3)), wcel(c3, universe))

thm mapsnf1o2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  fvex(cv(s0), c3)
  fnmpti(hs0, ccnv(c0), c1, cxp(c2, csn(cv(hs0))))

  diff.hs0.c(c3)
